info.title: Home Connect API
info.description:
This API provides access to home appliances enabled by Home Connect
(https://home-connect.com). Through the API programs can be started and
stopped, or home appliances configured and monitored. For instance, you can
start a cotton program on a washer and get a notification when the cycle is
complete.

To get started with this web client, visit https://developer.home-connect.com
and register an account. An application with a client ID for this API client
will be automatically generated for you.

In order to use this API in your own client, you need an OAuth 2 client
implementing the authorization code grant flow
(https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/authorization/flow).


More details can be found here: https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6749.txt

Authorization URL: https://api.home-connect.com/security/oauth/authorize

Token URL: https://api.home-connect.com/security/oauth/token

tags.name: images
tags.description: Access the camera in the fridge

Unauthorized.description: Unauthorized - No or invalid access token

Forbidden.description: Forbidden - Scope has not been granted

NotFound.description: The requested resource was not found

NotAcceptable.description: The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request.

RequestTimeout.description: API Server failed to produce an answer or has no connection to backend service

HomeApplianceError.description:
An error occured during communication with the home appliance or the home appliance itself
answered with an error, e.g. because the issued command was unacceptable in the current state.

WrongOperationState.description: Request cannot be performed since the OperationState is wrong

ProgramNotAvailable.description: The requested program is not available

ContentTypeError.description: The request's Content-Type is not supported.

QuotaError.description: The number of requests for a specific endpoint exceeded the quota of the client.

get.summary: Get all home appliances which are paired with the logged-in user account.
get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of all home appliances which are paired
with the logged-in user account. All paired home appliances are returned
independent of their current connection state. The connection state can
be retrieved within the field 'connected' of the respective home appliance.
The haId is the primary access key for further API access to a specific
home appliance.

get.summary: Get a specfic home appliances which are paired with the logged-in user account.
get.description:
This endpoint returns a specific home appliance which is paired with the
logged-in user account. It is returned independent of their current
connection state. The connection state can be retrieved within the field
'connected' of the respective home appliance.
The haId is the primary access key for further API access to a specific
home appliance.

get.summary: Get program which is currently executed

put.description:
By putting a program object to this endpoint, the system will try to
start it if all preconditions are fulfilled:
* Home appliance is connected
* *Remote Control* and *Remote Control Start Allowed* is enabled
* No other program is currently active

Furthermore, the program must exist on the home appliance and its
options must be set correctly.
Keys of program, which can be exected on an oven, are for instance:
* *Cooking.Oven.Program.HeatingMode.HotAir*
* *Cooking.Oven.Program.HeatingMode.TopBottomHeating*
* *Cooking.Oven.Program.HeatingMode.PizzaSetting*
* *Cooking.Oven.Program.HeatingMode.PreHeating*

Keys for options of these oven programs are:
* *Cooking.Oven.Option.SetpointTemperature*: 30 - 250 Â°C
* *BSH.Common.Option.Duration*: 1 - 86340 seconds

For further documentation, visit the appliance-specific programs pages:
* [Oven](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/oven/supported_programs_and_options)
* [Dishwasher](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/dishwasher/supported_programs_options)
* [Washer](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/washing-machine/supported_programs_and_options)
* [Dryer](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/dryer/supported_programs_and_options)
* [Coffee Machine](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/coffee-maker/supported_programs_and_options)
* [Hood](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/hood/supported_programs_and_options)
* [Cleaning Robot](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/cleaningrobot/supported_programs_and_options)

There are no programs available for fridges and hobs.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: description of the program to activate

delete.summary: Stop the program which is currently executed

get.summary: Get all options of the active program like temperature or duration.
get.description:
You can retrieve a list of options of the currently running program.

For detailed documentation of the available options, visit the appliance-specific programs pages:
* [Oven](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/oven/supported_programs_and_options)
* [Dishwasher](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/dishwasher/supported_programs_options)
* [Washer](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/washing-machine/supported_programs_and_options)
* [Dryer](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/dryer/supported_programs_and_options)
* [Coffee Machine](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/coffee-maker/supported_programs_and_options)
* [Hood](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/hood/supported_programs_and_options)
* [Cleaning Robot](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/cleaningrobot/supported_programs_and_options)

200.description: List of options of active program

put.summary: Set all options of the active program, e.g. to switch from preheating to the actual program options.
put.description:
Update the options for the currently running program.
With this API endpoint, you have to provide all options with
their new values. If you want to update only one option, you can use the
endpoint specific to that option.

Please note that changing options of the running program is currently only
supported by ovens.

parameters.name: optionkey
parameters.description: Key of the option, e.g. BSH.Common.Option.Duration

get.summary: Get one specific option of the active program, e.g. the duration.

put.summary: Set one specific option of the active program
put.description:
This operation can be used to modify one specific option of the active
program, e.g. to extend the duration of the active program by
another 5 minutes.

Please note that changing options of the running program is currently only
supported by ovens.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: option of the active program to set

get.summary: Get the program which is currently selected
get.description:
In most cases the selected program is the program which is currently
shown on the display of the home appliance. This program can then be
manually adjusted or started on the home appliance itself.

put.description:
In most cases the selected program is the program which is currently
shown on the display of the home appliance. This program can then be
manually adjusted or started on the home appliance itself.

A selected program will not be started automatically. You don't have
to set a program as selected first if you intend to start it via API -
you can set it directly as active program.

Selecting a program will update the available options and constraints
directly from the home appliance. Any changes to the available options
due to the state of the appliance is only reflected in the selected program.

get.summary: Get all options of selected program

200.description: List of options of selected program

put.summary: Set all options of selected program

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: description of the program to activate

parameters.name: optionkey
parameters.description: Feature Key of the option as defined in FMF, e.g. BSH.Common.Option.Duration

get.summary: Get specific option of selected program

put.summary: Set specific option of selected program

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: description of the program to activate

get.summary: Get all programs which are currently available on the given home appliance

parameters.name: programkey
parameters.description: key of specific program to return

get.summary: Get a list of available images

404.description: The requested image was not found

get.summary: Get a list of available settings
get.description:
Get a list of available setting of the home appliance.

Further documentation can be found here:
* [Power state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/settings/power_state)
* [Fridge temperature](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/settings/fridgetemperature)
* [Fridge super mode](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/settings/fridgesupermode)
* [Freezer temperature](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/settings/freezertemperature)
* [Freezer super mode](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/settings/freezersupermode)

get.summary: Get current status of home appliance
get.description:
A detailed description of the available status can be found here:

* [Remote control activation state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/status/remotecontrolactivationstate)
* [Remote start allowance state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/status/remotestartallowancestate)
* [Local control state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/status/localcontrolstate)
* [Operation state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/status/operation_state)
* [Door state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/status/door_state)

Several more device-specific states can be found [in the documentation](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/status/remotecontrolactivationstate).

200.description: Successful, returns an array of status variables

parameters.name: statuskey
parameters.description: key of the specific status to get

get.summary: Get current status of home appliance
get.description:
A detailed description of the available status can be found here:

* [Remote control activation state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/status/remotecontrolactivationstate)
* [Remote start allowance state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/status/remotestartallowancestate)
* [Local control state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/status/localcontrolstate)
* [Operation state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/status/operation_state)
* [Door state](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/status/door_state)

Several more device-specific states can be found [in the documentation](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/api/status/remotecontrolactivationstate).

get.summary: Get a list of supported commands of the home appliance

200.description: The request was successful. Return a list of commands.

put.summary: Execute a specific command of the home appliance

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: description of the command to send

get.summary: Get stream of events for one appliance - NOT WORKING WITH SWAGGER
get.description:
Server Sent Events are available as Eventsource API in JavaScript
and are implemented by various HTTP client libraries and tools
including curl.

Unfortunately, SSE is not compatible to OpenAPI specs and can therefore
not be properly specified within this API description.

An SSE event contains three parts separated by linebreaks: event, data and id.
Different events are separated by empty lines.

The event field can be one of these types: KEEP-ALIVE, STATUS, EVENT, NOTIFY, DISCONNECTED, CONNECTED.

In case of the event type being STATUS, EVENT or NOTIFY, the "data"
field is populated with the JSON object defined below.

The id contains the home appliance ID.

Further documentation can be found here:
* [Events availability matrix](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/monitoring/availabilitymatrix)
* [Program changes](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/monitoring/program_option_changes)
* [Option changes](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/monitoring/option_changes)
* [Program progress changes](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/monitoring/program_progress_changes)
* [Home appliance state changes](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/monitoring/appliance_state_changes)

200.description: Successful, returns status updates as Server Sent Events (SSE)

get.summary: Get stream of events for all appliances - NOT WORKING WITH SWAGGER
get.description:
Server Sent Events are available as Eventsource API in JavaScript
and are implemented by various HTTP client libraries and tools
including curl.

Unfortunately, SSE is not compatible to OpenAPI specs and can therefore
not be properly specified within this API description.

An SSE event contains three parts separated by linebreaks: event, data and id.
Different events are separated by empty lines.

The event field can be one of these types: KEEP-ALIVE, STATUS, EVENT, NOTIFY, DISCONNECTED, CONNECTED.

In case of the event type being STATUS, EVENT or NOTIFY, the "data"
field is populated with the JSON object defined below.

The id contains the home appliance ID.

Further documentation can be found here:
* [Events availability matrix](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/monitoring/availabilitymatrix)
* [Program changes](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/monitoring/program_option_changes)
* [Option changes](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/monitoring/option_changes)
* [Program progress changes](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/monitoring/program_progress_changes)
* [Home appliance state changes](https://developer.home-connect.com/docs/monitoring/appliance_state_changes)

200.description: Successful, returns status updates as Server Sent Events (SSE)

homeconnect_auth.description:
The Home Connect API uses the authorization code grant flow of the OAuth2
Authorization Framework as specified in RFC 6749 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749).
Authorization tokens have to be transmitted in the HTTP headers as defined
in RFC 6750 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6750).

scopes.IdentifyAppliance: Grants right to identify a home appliance under /api/homeappliances
scopes.Monitor: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings
scopes.Control: Grants access to modify resources under under /api/homeappliances except images and settings
scopes.Images: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/images
scopes.Settings: Grants access to read and modify resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/settings
scopes.Oven-Monitor: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on ovens
scopes.Oven-Control: Grants access to modify resources under under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on ovens
scopes.Oven-Settings: Grants access to read and modify resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/settings on ovens
scopes.Oven: Grants access to read or modify all resources under /api/homeappliances on ovens
scopes.Dishwasher-Monitor: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on dishwashers
scopes.Dishwasher-Control: Grants access to modify resources under under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on dishwashers
scopes.Dishwasher-Settings: Grants access to read and modify resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/settings on dishwashers
scopes.Dishwasher: Grants access to read or modify all resources under /api/homeappliances on dishwashers
scopes.Washer-Monitor: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on washers
scopes.Washer-Control: Grants access to modify resources under under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on washers
scopes.Washer-Settings: Grants access to read and modify resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/settings on washers
scopes.Washer: Grants access to read or modify all resources under /api/homeappliances on washers
scopes.Dryer-Monitor: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on dryers
scopes.Dryer-Control: Grants access to modify resources under under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on dryers
scopes.Dryer-Settings: Grants access to read and modify resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/settings on dryers
scopes.Dryer: Grants access to read or modify all resources under /api/homeappliances on dryers
scopes.FridgeFreezer-Monitor: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on fridgefreezers
scopes.FridgeFreezer-Control: Grants access to modify resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on fridgefreezers
scopes.FridgeFreezer-Settings: Grants access to read and modify resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/settings on fridgefreezers
scopes.FridgeFreezer-Images: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/images on fridgefreezers
scopes.FridgeFreezer: Grants access to read or modify all resources under /api/homeappliances on fridgefreezers
scopes.CoffeeMaker-Monitor: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on coffee makers
scopes.CoffeeMaker-Control: Grants access to modify resources under under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on coffee makers
scopes.CoffeeMaker-Settings: Grants access to read and modify resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/settings on coffee makers
scopes.CoffeeMaker: Grants access to read or modify all resources under /api/homeappliances on coffeemakers
scopes.Hob-Monitor: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on coffee makers
scopes.Hob-Control: Grants access to modify resources under under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on coffee makers
scopes.Hob-Settings: Grants access to read and modify resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/settings on coffee makers
scopes.Hob: Grants access to read or modify all resources under /api/homeappliances on coffeemakers
scopes.Hood-Monitor: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on coffee makers
scopes.Hood-Control: Grants access to modify resources under under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on coffee makers
scopes.Hood-Settings: Grants access to read and modify resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/settings on coffee makers
scopes.Hood: Grants access to read or modify all resources under /api/homeappliances on coffeemakers
scopes.CleaningRobot-Monitor: Grants access to read resources under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on coffee makers
scopes.CleaningRobot-Control: Grants access to modify resources under under /api/homeappliances except images and settings on coffee makers
scopes.CleaningRobot-Settings: Grants access to read and modify resources under /api/homeappliances/{haid}/settings on coffee makers
scopes.CleaningRobot: Grants access to read or modify all resources under /api/homeappliances on coffeemakers

haId.description: Unique identifier representing a specific home appliance.

name.description: User-friendly name of the home appliance (e.g. "My Oven")

brand.description: Brand of the home appliance, e.g. "BOSCH"

vib.description: The type code (VIB) of the home appliance.

enumber.description: Combination of VIB and customer index (VIB/KI)

connected.description: Current connection state of the home appliance. True if the home appliance is online, false otherwise.

ArrayOfHomeAppliances.description: Object containing an array of home appliances

haId.description: Unique identifier representing a specific home appliance.

name.description: User-friendly name of the home appliance (e.g. "My Oven")

brand.description: Brand of the home appliance, e.g. "BOSCH"

vib.description: The type code (VIB) of the home appliance.

enumber.description: Combination of VIB and customer index (VIB/KI)

connected.description: Current connection state of the home appliance. True if the home appliance is online, false otherwise.

error.description: The requested resource could not be found but may be available again in the future.
Resource representation is only available with these types:\napplication/vnd.bsh.sdk.v1+json
HomeAppliance did not respond to connection initialization requests in time, it might be offline
Request cannot be performed since no program is selected
Request cannot be performed since no active program is set
Request cannot be performed since OperationState is not DelayedStart, Run, Pause or ActionRequired
The request's Content-Type is not supported. Expected:\napplication/vnd.bsh.sdk.v1+json or application/vnd.bsh.sdk.v2+json or application/vnd.bsh.hca.v1+json or application/vnd.bsh.hca.v2+json
The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.
Could not validate permissions to access HomeAppliance

name.description: User-friendly name of the feature key

uri.description: URI of the resource that changed

timestamp.description: Creation time of event as unix timestamp

level.description: Level of the event, possible values: critical, alert, warning, hint, info

handling.description: Expected activity, possible values: none, acknowledge, decision

value.description: New value, e.g. in case of a status update

key.description: A key identifying a specific program

name.description: user-friendly, localized name of the program, e.g. "4D HeiÃluft" in German

key.description: a parameter for the given program, e.g. oven temperature

name.description: user-friendly, localized name of the option, e.g. "Adjust the duration"

value.description: the value of the parameter specified in "key", e.g. 200

unit.description: the unit of this parameter, e.g. "Â°C"

key.description: a key identifying an available program
a key identifying an available program

name.description: user-friendly, localized name of the program, e.g. "4D HeiÃluft" in German

key.description: a parameter for the given program, e.g. Cooking.Oven.Option.SetpointTemperature

name.description: user-friendly, localized name of the option, e.g. "Adjust the duration"

type.description: type of option, possible values - String, Int, Boolean, {Enumtype} e.g. ConsumerProducts.CoffeeMaker.EnumType.CoffeeTemperature

constraints.description: constraints of the option, e.g. step size, enumeration values, etc.

min.description: minimum value of the option, e.g. 70

max.description: maximum value of the option, e.g. 270

stepsize.description: allowed step-size of the option, e.g. 5

name.description: user-friendly, localized name of the option, e.g. "Adjust the duration"

value.description: the value of the parameter specified in "key", e.g. 200

unit.description: the unit of this parameter, e.g. "Â°C"

ArrayOfOptions.description: Array of options represented as triplets key, value, unit

name.description: user-friendly, localized name of the option, e.g. "Adjust the duration"

value.description: the value of the parameter specified in "key", e.g. 200

unit.description: the unit of this parameter, e.g. "Â°C"

ArrayOfImages.description: a list of images available from the home appliance

key.description: Feature key of image type, e.g. Refrigeration.FridgeFreezer.Status.DoorCameraPresentRefrigerator

name.description: user-friendly, localized name of the image type

previewimagekey.description: Unique identifier for the preview image

timestamp.description: Unix timestamp when the image was shot

quality.description:
Quality of the captured image, possible values: good, bad:
image is flagged bad e.g. if the door has been closed too fast to shoot a sharp picture

Setting.description: a setting object of the home appliance

value.description: the value of the parameter specified in "key", e.g. 200

unit.description: the unit of this parameter, e.g. "Â°C"

value.description: the value of the parameter specified in "key", e.g. 200

unit.description: the unit of this parameter, e.g. "Â°C"

value.description: the value of the parameter specified in "key", e.g. true or 180 or "BSH.Common.EnumType.OperationState.Ready"

key.description: The feature key of the command defined, e.g. BSH.Common.Command.PauseProgram
